title: (x) La Ralty classic serif - Hightower {Mike Y}
content:
I thought this was Garamond, but none of mine match. Whatthefont couldn’t figure it out either.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lar.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005339/http:/typophile.com/files/lar.jpg) | 8.06 KB |
author: evan

comments.content: Nothing yet? This looks mainstream to me - like an Adobe or Berthold font. But what?

I think it’s Hightower from Font Bureau. By Tobias Frere-Jones.

- Mike Yanega

Here is a link to [Hightower](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005339/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/hightower/) at MyFonts where you can test drive to match the sample.

(I ID’d it using the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005339/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php). The ‘a’ is the fourth type, so is the ‘y’ and the ‘R’, and then you look for the R in the 53 fonts that will show as matches for those three letters)

- Mike Yanega
